thread.title: Steve Morison out to heap more misery on Leicester in FA Cup with Millwall
thread.title_full: Steve Morison out to heap more misery on Leicester in FA Cup with Millwall

title: Steve Morison out to heap more misery on Leicester in FA Cup with Millwall
text:
Premier League Championship Scottish Premiership Steve Morison out to heap more misery on Leicester in FA Cup with Millwall MILLWALL star Steve Morison has backed his side to take advantage of Leicester’s “fragile” mental state and knock out another Premier League team at home on Saturday. PUBLISHED: 00:02, Wed, Feb 15, 2017 | UPDATED: 00:12, Wed, Feb 15, 2017 GETTY Steve Morison wants to knock out another Premier League team 
The Lions have already caused upsets against Bournemouth and Watford and now believe they can the add Claudio Ranieri’s under fire champions to the list in their fifth round tie. 
Leicester are a side severely lacking in confidence thanks to no league wins in 2017 and Morison, who scored in both the previous rounds of the cup, is confident of another shock. 
“We need to get on the front foot in terms of intensity, and if we do that, I think we can hurt them with our creative attacking play,” said the veteran striker. “Right now they’re having a bad patch of form and I think we can prey on that fragility when they come to The Den. GETTY Millwall have knocked out Bournemouth and Watford this season 
“I’ve been enjoying playing Prem teams, and I’ve actually found the games quite comfortable. They’re not as physical as the games we have in the league, so it’s more about bringing your quality to the fore.” 
Millwall were FA Cup runners-up just 13 years ago and the League One club are already dreaming of a Wembley return. Inside Arsenal's changing room for away clash at Sutton United Mon, January 30, 2017 Arsenal face a trip to non-league side Sutton United for their fifth round FA Cup clash and this is the changing room they'll use... Twitter 1 of 6 
“If we beat Leicester, we’re just 90 minutes away from a game at Wembley,” said Morison, 33. “If we can get the win on Saturday, I’ll allow myself to start thinking about playing there. 
“The players, the fans and the staff are all singing off the same hymn sheet at the minute, and that’s paying dividends on the pitch. We’re thoroughly enjoying playing at The Den right now, and long may it continue.” Related articles
